For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ‚àÄ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (Œ¥ : ‚Ñù) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 Œ¥ + s = Metric.thickening Œ¥ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

This theorem is a version of the Gr√∂nwall's inequality. It states that if a function `f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù` is continuous over the closed interval `[a, b]` and satisfies the two conditions: (1) `f a ‚â§ Œ¥`, and (2) for all `x` in the half-open interval `[a, b)`, the lower limit as `z` approaches `x` from the right side of `(f z - f x)/(z - x)` is less than or equal to `K * f x + Œµ`, then `f x` is bounded by `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` on the closed interval `[a, b]`. 

The function `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` is defined as `Œ¥ + Œµ * x` if `K = 0`, otherwise it is `(Œ¥ * exp(K * x) + Œµ / K * (exp(K * x) - 1))`. 

This theorem is particularly useful in the analysis of differential equations and provides an upper bound for the solution of an ordinary differential equation.

type:
‚àÄ {f f' : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù} {Œ¥ K Œµ a b : ‚Ñù},
  ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc a b) ‚Üí
    (‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Ico a b, ‚àÄ (r : ‚Ñù), f' x < r ‚Üí ‚àÉ·∂† (z : ‚Ñù) in nhdsWithin x (Set.Ioi x), (z - x)‚Åª¬π * (f z - f x) < r) ‚Üí
      f a ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚Üí (‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Ico a b, f' x ‚â§ K * f x + Œµ) ‚Üí ‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Icc a b, f x ‚â§ gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)
name: le_gronwallBound_of_liminf_deriv_right_le
docString:
This theorem is a version of the Gr√∂nwall's inequality. It states that if a function `f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù` is continuous over the closed interval `[a, b]` and satisfies the two conditions: (1) `f a ‚â§ Œ¥`, and (2) for all `x` in the half-open interval `[a, b)`, the lower limit as `z` approaches `x` from the right side of `(f z - f x)/(z - x)` is less than or equal to `K * f x + Œµ`, then `f x` is bounded by `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` on the closed interval `[a, b]`. 

The function `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` is defined as `Œ¥ + Œµ * x` if `K = 0`, otherwise it is `(Œ¥ * exp(K * x) + Œµ / K * (exp(K * x) - 1))`. 

This theorem is particularly useful in the analysis of differential equations and provides an upper bound for the solution of an ordinary differential equation.

If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `Œ¥`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‚Äñf' x - A‚Äñ ‚â§ Œ¥`.

    MeasurableSet s ‚Üí

name: ApproximatesLinearOn.norm_fderiv_sub_le
docString:

then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‚Äñf' x - A‚Äñ ‚â§ Œ¥`.

For any semi-normed addition-commutative group `E` and real number `Œ¥`, the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `Œ¥` from `x` is equal to the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `Œ¥` from `0` translated by `x`.

type: ‚àÄ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (Œ¥ : ‚Ñù) (x : E), x +·µ• Metric.closedBall 0 Œ¥ = Metric.closedBall x Œ¥

docString: For any semi-normed addition-commutative group `E` and real number `Œ¥`, the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `Œ¥` from `x` is equal to the set of elements with distance less than or equal to `Œ¥` from `0` translated by `x`.

This theorem provides a Gr√∂nwall-like inequality in the context of real-valued normed space. Suppose we have a function `f` from real numbers to a normed additively commutative group `E`, which is continuous on a closed interval `[a, b]`. This function has a right derivative `f' x` at every point `x` in the half-open interval `[a, b)`. If the norm of `f a` is less than or equal to a real number `Œ¥` and for all `x` in `[a, b)`, the norm of `f' x` is less than or equal to `K` times the norm of `f x` plus `Œµ`, then the norm of `f x` is bounded by the function `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` on the closed interval `[a, b]`. Here, `gronwallBound` is a function defined on four real variables, which has a different value if `K` equals 0 or not.

type:
‚àÄ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ‚Ñù E] {f f' : ‚Ñù ‚Üí E} {Œ¥ K Œµ a b : ‚Ñù},
  ContinuousOn f (Set.Icc a b) ‚Üí
    (‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Ico a b, HasDerivWithinAt f (f' x) (Set.Ici x) x) ‚Üí
      ‚Äñf a‚Äñ ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚Üí (‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Ico a b, ‚Äñf' x‚Äñ ‚â§ K * ‚Äñf x‚Äñ + Œµ) ‚Üí ‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Icc a b, ‚Äñf x‚Äñ ‚â§ gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)
name: norm_le_gronwallBound_of_norm_deriv_right_le
docString: This theorem provides a Gr√∂nwall-like inequality in the context of real-valued normed space. Suppose we have a function `f` from real numbers to a normed additively commutative group `E`, which is continuous on a closed interval `[a, b]`. This function has a right derivative `f' x` at every point `x` in the half-open interval `[a, b)`. If the norm of `f a` is less than or equal to a real number `Œ¥` and for all `x` in `[a, b)`, the norm of `f' x` is less than or equal to `K` times the norm of `f x` plus `Œµ`, then the norm of `f x` is bounded by the function `gronwallBound Œ¥ K Œµ (x - a)` on the closed interval `[a, b]`. Here, `gronwallBound` is a function defined on four real variables, which has a different value if `K` equals 0 or not.

Let `X` be a metric space. Let `K : Œπ ‚Üí Set X` be a locally finite family of closed sets, let
`U : Œπ ‚Üí Set X` be a family of open sets such that `K i ‚äÜ U i` for all `i`. Then there exists a
positive continuous function `Œ¥ : C(X, ‚Ñù)` such that for any `i` and `x ‚àà K i`, we have
`Metric.closedBall x (Œ¥ x) ‚äÜ U i`.
